documentation.text:
@dev maps a contract type (e.g. "pool" or "lp_token", as defined in constants above)
 to a mapping from an implementation name to the actual implementation
 The implementation name is decided when registering the implementation
 and can be arbitrary (e.g. "ERC20PoolV1")

addLpTokenImplementation(bytes32,address.notice: Add a new LP token implementation to the factory.

params.implementation: of lp token implementation to add.
params.name: of the LP token implementation.

addPoolImplementation(bytes32,address).notice: Add a new pool implementation to the factory.

addStakerVaultImplementation(bytes32,add.notice: Add a new staker vault implementation to the factory.

params.implementation: of staker vault implementation to add.
params.name: of the staker vault implementation.

addVaultImplementation(bytes32,address).notice: Add a new vault implementation to the factory.

deployPool(string,uint256,address,(strin.details: Decimals is an argument as not all ERC20 tokens implement the ERC20Detailed interface.      An implementation where `getUnderlying()` returns the zero address is for ETH pools.
deployPool(string,uint256,address,(strin.notice: Deploys a new pool and LP token.

params.implementationNames: Name of the implementations to use
params.lpTokenArgs: Arguments to create the LP token for the pool

returns.addrs: Address of the deployed pool, address of the pool's deployed LP token.

implementations.details: maps a contract type (e.g. "pool" or "lp_token", as defined in constants above) to a mapping from an implementation name to the actual implementation The implementation name is decided when registering the implementation and can be arbitrary (e.g. "ERC20PoolV1")
